ibis.io
Class ByteSerializationInputStream

java.lang.Object
  ibis.io.IOProperties
      ibis.io.SerializationBase
          ibis.io.ByteSerializationInputStream
All Implemented Interfaces:
Constants, DataInput, SerializationInput
Direct Known Subclasses:
DataSerializationInputStream
public class ByteSerializationInputStream
extends SerializationBase
implements SerializationInput

The ByteSerializationInputStream class can be used when only byte serialization is needed. It provides an implementation for the SerializationInput interface, built on methods in InputStream. However, the only data that can be read are bytes and byte arrays. All other methods throw an exception. It also provides a base class for "data" serialization and "ibis" serialization.

clear

public void clear()
Description copied from interface: SerializationInput
Ibis serialization profits from an explicit clear of the object table, so that any stubs in it can be garbage-collected. This significantly reduces the number of connections kept alive.

Specified by:
clear in interface SerializationInput
